Main Function for Genomic Distance Calculation and Phylogenetic Tree Construction

fit.Rd

This is the enhanced main function that computes genomic distances between samples with flexible distance function selection, processes the data, and constructs a phylogenetic tree. It supports different distance metrics for greedy (G) and BFB (B) distance calculations.

Usage

fit(
  data,
  chromosomes = c(1:22, "X", "Y"),
  alleles = c("A", "B"),
  k_jitter_fix = 0,
  bfb_penalty = 0,
  tree_func = ape::nj,
  fillna = 0,
  g_dist_func = "greedy_fast",
  b_dist_func = "bfb_fast",
  ...
)

Arguments

data

Input data containing genomic information. Should be a data frame with columns

  • cell_id - Cell identifier

  • chr - Chromosome name

  • start - Start of genomic bin

  • end - End of genomic bin

  • CN - Total copy number

  • A - Copy number of allele A

  • B - Copy number of allele B

chromosomes

Vector of chromosomes to include in analysis (default: 1:22, "X", "Y").

alleles

Alleles to consider (default: c(A", "B"), alternative: "CN").

k_jitter_fix

Jitter factor for numerical stability (default: 0).

bfb_penalty

Penalty for breakage-fusion-bridge events (default: 0).

tree_func

Function to use for tree construction (default: ape::nj).

fillna

Value to fill NA entries (default: 0).

g_dist_func

Distance function to use for greedy calculation. Must be one of the available G functions (default: "greedy_fast").

b_dist_func

Distance function to use for BFB calculation. Must be one of the available B functions (default: "bfb_fast").

...

Additional arguments passed to downstream functions.

Value

A list containing:

  • tree - The constructed phylogenetic tree

  • all_input_Xs - Processed input data

  • D - Final distance matrix

  • greedy_Ds - Greedy distance matrices

  • avg_Ds - Balanced distance matrices

  • g_dist_func - Name of the used G distance function

  • b_dist_func - Name of the used B distance function

Details

The function performs the following steps:

  1. Validates the selected distance functions

  2. Processes input data

  3. Computes distances using selected functions

  4. Merges distance matrices

  5. Optionally sums across minor alleles

  6. Constructs phylogenetic tree

Available distance functions can be checked via names(G_DISTS) and names(B_DISTS).
